DataElement.preferredName: Disease Primary Anatomic Site ICD-O-3 Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location within the body where cancer begins as captured in the topography codes of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (ICD-O-3). Example - C02.8

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2/6/23 released/standard per Smita/DSS. jk; 1/30/23 Upd OC from Dx to Disease per jk. mr; 11/21/22 Released per CRDC DSS. mr;  9/28/22 Created per CRDC DSS RFC15. mr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition
Concepts.definition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition Anatomic Site Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.:Named locations of, or within, the body.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition
Concepts.definition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.
Named locations of or within the body.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.administrativeNotes:
3/30/23 Restored concepts for ICD-O-3 C87061 and Site C13717 that were somehow missing. mr; 
2/6/23 released/standard per Smita/DSS. jk; 12/6/22 Changed to enumerated and added single PV pointing to ICD-O-3. Added max len to allow for PV. mr; 12/1/22 Created per CRDC DSS to replace 3226280, an older ICD-O-3 VD that had type Alphanumeric, and so we can add ref doc instructions here. mr;

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRDC Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description:
1.	Go to http://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx 
2.	Create and activate account.
3.	Go back to URL in step 1, log in, and click on the ICD-O-3 link in the left hand column, which downloads the "ICD-O-3_CSV-metadata.zip" file.
4.	Unzip the file, use the text file named “Topoenglish.txt" for the ICD-O-3 codes.
